snippet: Heritage Field is the last piece in the city’s seven-year struggle to replace the parkland used for the new stadium.
abstract: New York City opens Heritage Field public ballpark across the street from Yankee Stadium in the Bronx; $50.8 million park, on the site of the old Yankee Stadium, is the last piece in the city's seven-year struggle to replace Bronx public parkland that was usurped by the new stadium, angering area residents.
lead_paragraph: Heritage Field is the last piece in the city’s seven-year struggle to replace the parkland used for the new stadium.

headline.seo: Heritage Field Opens Near Yankee Stadium
headline.main: A Public Park to Rival the Yankees’ Playground
headline.print_headline: A Public Park to Rival the Yankees’ Playground
